instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 No camera detected
threads.message: Hello. So I have on the bench an 820-00165 board that came in because the camera is not being recognized. I tried a known good test screen with another camera but it still says the same thing. I measured for PP1V2_CAM, PP1V35_CAM and PP1V8_CAM and they all seem to be present. I am also getting the I2C voltages at the camera connector. I will say this board has been worked on previously by someone else. the edge bonding is gone from SMC, and J6100 is removed. Any advice would be appreciated. The customer is insistent on having a camera.

threads.title: 820-00165 No camera detected
threads.message:
Check L4007/09 first.
Also check data lines in diode mode to ground.

threads.title: 820-00165 No camera detected
threads.message: L4007/09 Check ok, and I got .415V in diode mode to pins 5 & 6 of camera connector.

threads.title: 820-00165 No camera detected
threads.message:
"I will say this board has been worked on previously by someone else"
Possibly BIOS messed up.
Try FULL new BIOS, clean ME.
You should find some link on the forum.
If not, upload your backup somewhere.
Check if serial number from back cover is the same reported by OSX.

threads.title: 820-00165 No camera detected
threads.message: Ok. I will have to pull SPI rom. I?ll post backup and send link
